intro: Lycianthes mariovelizii, commonly known as the Mariovelizii bitterleaf, is a species of flowering plant in the Solanaceae family. It is native to Central America and is characterized by its small, ovate leaves and clusters of yellowish-white flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically green when unripe and turn red when mature. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats within tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a relatively rare and understudied species.
